content.prompt: Which of the following is an accurate description of the Mexican judiciary?

choices.label: There is no functioning Supreme Court in Mexico.
Mexico's judiciary does not have the power of judicial review.
Supreme Court justices are appointed by the president and confirmed by the Senate.
Supreme Court justices are appointed to a life term.

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Describe political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors of a course country.
